inlineContent.text: Utilize various MapContent like MapCircle, MapPolygon, and MapPolyline to
visualize restaurant proximity zones, delivery areas, and more.
Basic MapCircle
Draw a circle by specifying center coordinates and radius (in meters).
Visualize a 500m walking distance radius.
Set fill color and transparency with .foregroundStyle.
Add a border with .stroke.
Customizing Style
Displaying Multiple Radii Simultaneously
Display 5-minute walk (400m) and 10-minute walk (800m) radii
in different colors simultaneously.
MapCircle draws a circular area centered on specific coordinates.
It‚Äôs ideal for showing walking distance or delivery radius around a restaurant.
MapPolygon draws polygonal areas.
You can display delivery zones or specific neighborhood boundaries.
Define a polygonal area with a coordinate array.
Display part of the Gangnam district as a delivery zone.
Delivery Zone Polygon
Apply semi-transparent fill and dashed border.
Use different color themes for each zone.
Styling Polygons
MapPolyline draws a line connecting multiple coordinates.
You can preview the walking path to a restaurant.
Basic Polyline
Draw a line connecting an array of coordinates.
Display the path from the current location to the restaurant.
Customize line thickness, color, and dash patterns.
You can also use gradient lines to indicate direction.
Setting Line Style
Highlighting Selected Restaurant
Highlight the selected restaurant along with its surrounding radius.
Lower the opacity of other restaurants.
When filtering by ‚ÄúWithin 10 minutes walk,‚Äù highlight only that area.
Conditionally control MapCircle visibility.
Displaying Zones by Filter
Combine MapContent elements to create
an information-rich map.
What is the unit for MapCircle‚Äôs radius parameter?
The radius in MapCircle(center:radius:) is in meters.
Entering 500 draws a circle with a 500m radius.
Meters (m)
Kilometers (km)
It‚Äôs in meters. Enter 1000 for a 1km radius.
Points (pt)
MapCircle‚Äôs radius is in real distance units (meters).
It displays real distances regardless of screen size.
What is the difference between MapPolyline and MKRoute?
MapPolyline simply connects given coordinates.
MKRoute is the actual path calculated following roads.
MapPolyline is a simple line, MKRoute is actual route calculation result
They‚Äôre the same functionality with different names
MapPolyline connects coordinates, MKRoute is a route search result.
They serve different purposes.
MapPolyline is more accurate
MKRoute is the accurate path that reflects actual roads and traffic information.
